FREEWHEEL

Lead Analyst ‚Ä¢ 2025-Present

Founded, architected, and governed the analytics function for a 0-to-1 Commercial Operations business unit. Served as the primary C-Suite advisor to the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO), directing strategic decision support and scaling performance measurement across six sales organizations. > > > Architected the end-to-end Sales Performance Monitoring ecosystem, deploying real-time pacing and KPI dashboards across six distinct sales organizations. This initiative streamlined operations by eliminating 120 hrs/week of manual data compilation and directly enabled >$1 billion in annual quota attainment. Instituted and governed the unified metrics definition for the CCO‚Äôs Monthly Business Review (MBR) and Weekly Readouts. This established the single source of truth for growth and profitability, driving cross-organizational consensus at the C-level within the Comcast ecosystem Integrated ML-driven risk models into core commercial workflows to proactively highlight emerging portfolio risks and attention gaps, accelerating critical high-value commercial decisions by 48 hours and improving resource targeting

title: Marketing A/B Test
text:
Python ‚Ä¢ Stats  

Buisness Case
For this analysis, we‚Äôll examine customer churn results based on an A/B test. We‚Äôll pull our data from a CSV into a pandas dataframe.

title: Marketing A/B Test
text:
‚ö° EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
We tested a new ‚ÄúSingle-Page Checkout‚Äù against the baseline. The test reached statistical significance (\(p < 0.05\)) with a 4.2% lift in conversion, representing a potential $200k ARR increase

title: Marketing A/B Test
text:
üöÄ RECOMMENDATIONS

Full Rollout: Deploy the variant to 100% of traffic.
Monitor LTV: Track these users for 90 days to ensure ‚ÄúEasy Checkout‚Äù doesn‚Äôt increase return rates.
Iterate: Test ‚ÄúGuest Checkout‚Äù next to further reduce friction.

title: Unveiling Hidden Patterns
text:
The Goal: Identify non-obvious store performance trends to assist marketing budget allocation.
The Result: Successfully segmented stores into 4 distinct performance clusters validated by ANOVA (\(p < 0.001\)) and a strong effect size (Cohen‚Äôs \(d > 0.8\)).

title: Unveiling Hidden Patterns
text:
The Goal: Identify non-obvious store performance trends to assist marketing budget allocation.
The Result: Successfully segmented stores into 4 distinct performance clusters validated by ANOVA (\(p < 0.001\)) and a strong effect size (Cohen‚Äôs \(d > 0.8\)).

title: Unveiling Hidden Patterns
text:
üìã The Hypothetical

Prompt: A marketing decision-maker needs to determine if there are trends across store performance that aren‚Äôt initially obvious.

We are working with Walmart sales data. While limited in scope, this serves as a critical Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to justify deeper segmentation marketing strategies.
import pandas as pd import numpy as np import seaborn as sns import matplotlib.pyplot as plt from scipy.stats import f_oneway from sklearn.metrics import silhouette_score from scipy.cluster import hierarchy

title: Predicting Marketing Success
text:
The Objective: Determine if Education level serves as a primary driver for marketing campaign acceptance.
Key Finding: While Education initially appears significant, it is actually a proxy for Income. Income maintains a high correlation (0.82) with total spend and acts as a statistically significant predictor in logistic regression.

title: Predicting Marketing Success
text:
The Objective: Determine if Education level serves as a primary driver for marketing campaign acceptance.
Key Finding: While Education initially appears significant, it is actually a proxy for Income. Income maintains a high correlation (0.82) with total spend and acts as a statistically significant predictor in logistic regression.

title: Predicting Marketing Success
text:
üìã Project Motivation
Using a dataset provided by iFood, we examine the relationship between a user‚Äôs educational background and their likelihood to accept marketing offers.
